item.title: April add a quote by P. J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it." -- P. J. O'Rourke

item.title: April add a quote by P.J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Giving money and power to government is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys." -- P.J. O'Rourke

item.title: April add a quote by P.J. O'Rourke
item.description: "It's better to spend money like there's no tomorrow than to spend tonight like there's no money." -- P.J. O'Rourke

item.title: April add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Never confuse faith, or belief—of any kind—with something even remotely intellectual." -- John Irving

item.title: April add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "When Jack Burns needed to hold his mother's hand, his fingers could see in the dark." -- John Irving

item.title: April add a quote by Wil Wheaton
item.description: "I can't believe you said that about fire ants and thunderstorms! You are such a Houstonist!" -- Wil Wheaton

item.title: April add a quote by Stephanie Klein
item.description: "What we wait around a lifetime for with one person, we can find in a moment with someone else." -- Stephanie Klein

item.title: April add a quote by Ruth Ozeki
item.description: "Am I crazy?" she asked. "I feel like I am sometimes." "Maybe," he said, rubbing her forehead. "But don't worry about it. You need to be a little bit crazy. Crazy is the price you pay for having an imagination. It's your superpower. Tapping into the dream. It's a good thing not a bad thing." -- Ruth Ozeki

item.title: April add a quote by Ruth Ozeki
item.description:
"She sat back on her heels and nodded. The thought experiment she proposed was certainly odd, but her point was simple. Everything in the universe was constantly changing, and nothing stays the same, and we must understand how quickly time flows by if we are to wake up and truly live our lives.
That’s what it means to be a time being, old Jiko told me, and then she snapped her crooked fingers again.
And just like that, you die." -- Ruth Ozeki
